cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WSW of Marco Island, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast (near the MS-AL border)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi–Alabama border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama–Florida border; Storm Surge Watch west of Shell Beach LA to the mouth of the Mississippi River and east of the Mississippi-Alabama border to Navarre FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Golden Beach FL to Bonita Beach FL, including Florida Bay; additional TS warning from the Okaloosa-Walton County line westward to east of Morgan City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central and southwest Florida coast (including Florida Keys) Monday, then the central Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle late Tuesday through Wednesday
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds 40–50 mph (with higher gusts) impacting PortMiami Monday morning through afternoon
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (less than 2 ft) possible but significant surge not expected on the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches common with isolated pockets up to 8 inches, causing localized street and terminal flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible across the southern Florida peninsula during Monday
